In each iteration, the outer loop `t` increases by one, which means that we are considering the next element in the sorted part of the array. If an element is smaller than `arr[t]`, it is moved to its correct position, which is after `arr[t]`.

This invariant ensures that at the end of each iteration, the elements in the array are sorted in ascending order, and that the next element to be considered is indeed the next element in the sorted part of the array.
